xml.brief: Get information on available geocache properties

desc.p: Returns information on available geocache properties at this OKAPI installation.

You may need this method when editing geocache listings and when searching for caches by type. In all other cases, you don't need to know about differences between OKAPI installations. But still this method may help to improve usability of your app, e.g. by hiding unnecessary search options.

opt.name: fields
opt.p: Pipe-separated list of field names which you are interested in. Selected fields will be included in the response. See below for the list of available fields.

opt.name: langpref
opt.p: Pipe-separated list of ISO 639-1 language codes. This indicates the order of preference in which language will be chosen for the names in fields languages and countries. Note that this option is ignored for the regions field, which will always return names in local language.

opt.name: cache_type
opt.p: One of the cache type indentifiers returned in the types field by an earlier call to this method. If supplied, the sizes and password_max_length return values will reflect the capabilities for this type of cache.

returns.p: A dictionary of the fields you have selected. Currently available fields:

li.p: types - list of the cache types which are currently available at this installation. See the services/caches/geocache method for more information on cache types.

sizes - list of the cache sizes which are currently available at this installation [for the given cache_type]. Note that the returned identifiers correspond the size2 field of services/caches/geocache, not the deprecated size field.
statuses - list of the cache statuses which are currently available at this installation. See the services/caches/geocache method for more information on cache statuses.
has_ratings - boolean, true if this installation can store geocache quality ratings. Use the services/logs/capabilities method to find out if a given geocache can be rated.
languages - a dictionary (language code => name) of available languages for geocache descriptions and hints.

primary_languages - a list of codes of the preferred or mostly used languages at this OC site, ordered descending by relevance. You may suggest this set of languages first when your user edits cache descriptions (we recommend to present them in alphabetical order).
countries - a dictionary (country code => name) of countries that can be assigned to geocache listings.

regions - a dictionary (country code => region) of countries, each containing a dictionary (region code => name) of regions that can be assigned to geocache listings. If can_set_region is false, then the return value currently is null, but this may change. Also, the length of the codes (which currently is always 4 characters) may change.
can_set_region - boolean, true if services/caches/edit will accept the region parameter. If false, then this installation will automatically calculate regions from the cache location.
password_max_length - the maximum length of a password that will be accepted by services/caches/edit [for the given cache_type]. The value 0 indicates that no password can be set.
